question: What is the minimum attendance required to sit for exams?
answer: Students must maintain at least 75% attendance in each subject to be eligible for semester exams.

question: Can I attend classes after getting a medical leave?
answer: Yes you can attend classes after medical leave but the absent days will still count unless you submit a valid medical certificate within 3 days of returning.

question: What happens if my attendance falls below 75%?
answer: You will be detained from appearing in the semester exam for the subjects where attendance is below 75%.

question: How is attendance calculated for practical sessions?
answer: Practical attendance is calculated separately from theory classes and you must maintain 75% in both independently.

question: Is there any provision to condone shortage of attendance?
answer: Condonation up to 10% shortage may be granted by the principal on medical grounds with supporting documents.

question: Can I check my attendance online?
answer: Yes you can check subject-wise attendance through the student portal at the university website using your roll number and password.

question: Will late entry to class be counted as absent?
answer: Students arriving more than 10 minutes late will be marked absent for that session.

question: How many days can I be absent in a semester without academic consequences?
answer: You can miss up to 25% of classes per subject without academic penalty but must inform the department.

question: What is the process for regularizing attendance after a long absence?
answer: Submit a leave application with supporting documents to the HOD within 5 working days of returning.

question: Do online classes count towards attendance?
answer: Yes attendance in authorized online sessions is counted equivalent to physical attendance.

question: What is the grading system followed by the university?
answer: The university follows a 10-point CGPA grading system where O is 10 points A+ is 9 A is 8 B+ is 7 B is 6 C is 5 and F is fail.

question: What is the minimum CGPA required to pass a semester?
answer: Students must secure a minimum CGPA of 5.0 and no individual subject grade below C to pass the semester.

question: How do I calculate my CGPA?
answer: CGPA is calculated by multiplying each subject's grade point by its credit hours summing them and dividing by total credit hours.

question: When are semester grades published?
answer: Grade results are typically published within 3 weeks after the last exam on the university results portal.

question: Can I apply for re-evaluation of my answer sheet?
answer: Yes you can apply for re-evaluation within 15 days of result publication by paying a fee of Rs 500 per subject.

question: What is a backlog subject?
answer: A backlog subject is one in which you received a failing grade and must reappear in the supplementary exam.

question: How many backlog subjects can I carry to the next semester?
answer: You can carry up to 3 backlog subjects to the next semester but more than that may result in semester repetition.

question: Is there a grace mark policy?
answer: Yes the university grants up to 5 grace marks in one subject per semester to help students pass.

question: How do I apply for a grade improvement exam?
answer: Grade improvement exams are held after final results and you can apply through the exam section with a fee of Rs 400 per subject.

question: What is the difference between internal and external marks?
answer: Internal marks are based on assignments tests and attendance and form 40% of total marks while external exam forms the remaining 60%.

question: How do I register for elective courses?
answer: Log in to the student portal during the elective registration window and select your preferred elective from the available list.

question: What is the credit system followed?
answer: The university follows the Choice Based Credit System where each course has assigned credits ranging from 1 to 4.

question: Can I drop a course after registration?
answer: Course drop requests can be made within the first two weeks of semester with HOD approval and no academic penalty.

question: What is the maximum number of courses I can register per semester?
answer: Students can register a maximum of 7 courses or 24 credits per semester.

question: Are supplementary notes or lecture materials available online?
answer: Yes faculty upload lecture slides and notes on the university learning management system within 3 days of the lecture.

question: What is the eligibility to appear for final semester exams?
answer: Students must have 75% attendance and cleared all fee dues to appear for final semester exams.

question: Can I request a change of course section?
answer: Section change requests are accepted in the first week of the semester subject to seat availability and HOD approval.

question: What is the maximum time to complete my degree?
answer: Students must complete their degree within twice the normal program duration otherwise their enrollment is cancelled.

question: Are there any honors or distinction criteria?
answer: Students who maintain above 8.5 CGPA throughout with no backlogs are awarded honors at graduation.

question: What is the format of the internal assessment test?
answer: Internal assessment tests are 1.5 hour written exams held twice per semester covering recent syllabus portions.

question: What documents are required for admission to undergraduate programs?
answer: You need class 10 and 12 mark sheets transfer certificate migration certificate passport photos caste certificate and Aadhaar card.

question: Is there a management quota for admission?
answer: Yes 15% of seats are reserved under management quota and applications must be submitted directly to the admissions office.

question: How do I apply for admission online?
answer: Visit the university admissions portal fill the online form upload required documents and pay the application fee of Rs 500.

question: What is the last date to apply for undergraduate admission?
answer: Applications for undergraduate programs close on June 30 every year. Check the university website for exact dates.

question: Can I apply to multiple programs in the same application?
answer: Yes you can list up to 3 program preferences in a single application form ranked in order of priority.

question: What is the eligibility for MBA admission?
answer: Candidates must have a bachelor's degree with minimum 50% marks and a valid score in CAT MAT or CMAT.

question: Is there an entrance exam for engineering admission?
answer: Admission to engineering programs is based on JEE Main scores and state-level counseling ranks.

question: What happens if I miss the document verification date?
answer: If you miss the document verification date without prior notice your provisional admission may be cancelled.

question: Can I defer my admission to the next academic year?
answer: Deferment is allowed only in exceptional cases with prior written approval from the registrar and forfeiture of admission fee.

question: Are transfer admissions accepted?
answer: Lateral entry transfers are accepted for second-year undergraduate programs based on merit and seat availability.

question: What is the deadline for fee payment after admission confirmation?
answer: You must pay the first semester fee within 7 days of receiving the admission confirmation letter to secure your seat.

question: What is the tuition fee for the B.Tech program?
answer: The B.Tech program costs Rs 85000 per semester excluding hostel and other charges.

question: Is the application fee refundable if not selected?
answer: No the application fee of Rs 500 is non-refundable regardless of admission outcome.

question: What is the fee structure for MBA?
answer: The MBA program fee is Rs 12000 per semester which includes tuition library and lab charges.

question: Are there any additional fees apart from tuition?
answer: Yes there are additional fees for exam registration student activity fund library and internet totaling approximately Rs 8000 per semester.

question: What payment methods are accepted for fee payment?
answer: Fee can be paid via net banking UPI demand draft or credit/debit card through the university payment portal.

question: Can I pay fees in installments?
answer: Yes fees can be paid in two installments with the first installment due at the start of the semester and the second by mid-semester.

question: Is there a late fee penalty?
answer: A late fee penalty of Rs 100 per day is charged.

question: What is the hostel fee per semester?
answer: Hostel fee ranges from Rs 35000 to Rs 45000 per semester depending on the room type and meal plan.

question: Will I get a fee receipt after payment?
answer: Yes an automated payment receipt is generated and emailed to your registered email within 24 hours of payment.

question: How do I get a fee payment confirmation letter?
answer: Log in to the student portal go to Finance section and download the official fee payment confirmation letter.

question: What scholarships are available for meritorious students?
answer: The university offers merit scholarships of Rs 10000 to Rs 50000 per semester for students maintaining CGPA above 8.0.

question: How do I apply for the government scholarship?
answer: Submit the scholarship form along with income certificate caste certificate and mark sheets to the scholarship section by September 30.

question: Is there a scholarship for students from rural areas?
answer: Yes the Rural Talent Scholarship offers Rs 15000 per year to students from rural backgrounds with income below Rs 3 lakhs.

question: What is the last date to apply for scholarships?
answer: Most scholarship applications close by October 15. Refer to the scholarship portal for program-specific deadlines.

question: Can I receive multiple scholarships simultaneously?
answer: You can receive only one university scholarship at a time but university and government scholarships can be combined.

question: What is the income limit for need-based scholarships?
answer: The annual family income must be below Rs 6 lakhs to qualify for need-based financial assistance.

question: How long does scholarship processing take?
answer: Scholarship processing typically takes 6 to 8 weeks after submission of complete documents.

question: What happens if my CGPA drops below the scholarship threshold?
answer: Your scholarship will be suspended for the next semester and reinstated if your CGPA recovers.

question: Is there a scholarship for sports achievers?
answer: Yes students representing the state or national level in sports can apply for the Sports Excellence Scholarship worth Rs 20000 per year.

question: How do I check the status of my scholarship application?
answer: Log in to the scholarship portal using your enrollment number and check the application status under My Applications.

question: What is the refund policy if I withdraw from the program?
answer: If withdrawal is done within 15 days of admission 90% of tuition fee is refunded. No refund after 30 days.

question: Can I get a refund if I cancel my hostel booking?
answer: Hostel booking cancellations made 30 days before the semester start get a 75% refund. No refund after the semester begins.

question: How long does a fee refund take to process?
answer: Refunds are processed within 20 working days after approval of the refund request.

question: What documents are needed to request a refund?
answer: Submit a refund request form original fee receipt admission cancellation letter and bank account details to the finance office.

question: Will the application fee be refunded if I withdraw?
answer: The application fee is non-refundable but the caution deposit of Rs 5000 is refundable on program completion or withdrawal.

question: What is the process for exam fee refund if I cannot appear?
answer: Submit a medical certificate or valid reason within 5 days of the exam. Refund is approved on a case-by-case basis.

question: Is the hostel security deposit refundable?
answer: Yes the hostel security deposit of Rs 5000 is fully refundable after inspection of the room on the day of checkout.

question: Can I get a refund if I failed to get a visa and cannot join?
answer: International students who cannot obtain a visa can get a full refund of tuition minus administrative charges of Rs 20000

question: Are activity fees refundable?
answer: Activity fees are non-refundable once the semester has commenced.

question: Who do I contact for fee refund queries?
answer: Contact the Finance Department at finance@university.edu or visit Room 102 in the Admin Block between 10am and 3pm.

question: How do I apply for a student ID card?
answer: Fill the ID card application form available at the student services desk submit your photo and pay Rs 50. Cards are issued within 5 working days.

question: What should I do if I lose my ID card?
answer: Report the loss immediately to the student services office pay a replacement fee of Rs 150 and submit a new passport photo.

question: Is the student ID card mandatory on campus?
answer: Yes the student ID card must be carried at all times on campus and shown to security staff when required.

question: Can I use my student ID for library access?
answer: Yes your student ID is linked to the library system and must be presented to borrow or return books.

question: Does the student ID card expire?
answer: Yes the student ID is valid for one academic year and must be renewed at the start of each new academic year at no extra charge.

question: How do I get a provisional ID card while waiting for the original?
answer: You can get a temporary ID from the student services office valid for 15 days while your original is being processed.

question: Can I update my photo on the student ID card?
answer: Photo updates require a formal request to the student services office along with a new passport photo and ID update fee of Rs 50.

question: Is there a digital version of the student ID card?
answer: Yes a digital ID card can be downloaded from the student portal and is valid for all official purposes on campus.

question: What details are printed on the student ID card?
answer: The card includes your name photo enrollment number program department and validity period.

question: Do alumni retain their student ID card privileges?
answer: Alumni are issued separate alumni ID cards which provide access to the library and select campus events.

question: How do I apply for a bonafide certificate?
answer: Submit a request through the student portal specifying the purpose. Certificates are issued within 3 working days.

question: What is a bonafide certificate used for?
answer: A bonafide certificate confirms you are an enrolled student and is used for bank accounts visa applications scholarships and more.

question: How do I get a medium of instruction certificate?
answer: Apply at the student services desk with your enrollment number. The certificate is issued within 5 working days at no cost.

question: Can I get a transcript for foreign university applications?
answer: Yes official transcripts sealed and stamped are issued within 7 working days. Submit the request form and Rs 300 per copy.

question: How many copies of transcripts can I request at once?
answer: You can request up to 5 certified copies of transcripts in a single application.

question: What documents are needed to apply for a migration certificate?
answer: Submit your original ID card TC request form and dues clearance certificate to the examination section.

question: How do I apply for a duplicate mark sheet?
answer: Submit an FIR copy affidavit from notary and pay Rs 200 to the examination office. Duplicate is issued in 10 working days.

question: Can I request urgent processing of certificates?
answer: Yes express processing is available for bonafide and provisional certificates at an additional fee of Rs 100 with 24-hour turnaround.

question: Are digital copies of certificates accepted?
answer: Digital copies with the official university QR code signature are valid for most purposes. Physical copies can also be requested.

question: How do I get a course completion certificate?
answer: Apply after completing all credits and clearing dues. The certificate is issued after the convocation or on request within 15 working days.

question: How do I file a complaint against a faculty member?
answer: Submit a written complaint to the head of department. If unresolved escalate to the dean of academic affairs within 7 days.

question: What is the process to report ragging?
answer: Call the anti-ragging helpline 1800-180-5522 or email antirag@university.edu. All complaints are investigated within 48 hours.

question: Can I submit a complaint anonymously?
answer: Anonymous complaints about general issues can be submitted through the suggestion box or online portal but named complaints are handled more effectively.

question: What happens after I file a grievance?
answer: You will receive an acknowledgement within 24 hours and a resolution within 15 working days from the grievance committee.

question: Is there a student ombudsperson I can approach?
answer: Yes the university has a student ombudsperson who handles unresolved grievances. Contact at ombuds@university.edu.

question: Can I complain about hostel facilities?
answer: Yes submit hostel complaints to the hostel warden or use the online complaint portal. Issues are addressed within 48 hours.

question: Who do I contact for sexual harassment complaints?
answer: Contact the Internal Complaints Committee at icc@university.edu. The ICC is mandated to respond within 90 days.

question: What if my complaint is not resolved in time?
answer: You can escalate unresolved complaints to the registrar or vice chancellor after the stipulated resolution period has passed.

question: How do I report a cyber harassment incident?
answer: Report cyber harassment to the IT department at cybersecurity@university.edu or visit the IT help desk in Block C.

question: Is my complaint identity kept confidential?
answer: Yes the university maintains strict confidentiality for all complaints and the complainant's identity is protected.

question: What are the library working hours?
answer: The central library is open from 8 AM to 10 PM on weekdays and 9 AM to 6 PM on weekends.

question: How many books can I borrow from the library?
answer: Undergraduate students can borrow up to 3 books and postgraduate students up to 5 books at a time.

question: What is the borrowing duration for library books?
answer: Books can be borrowed for 14 days. Renewal is allowed twice online if no one else has reserved the book.

question: What is the fine for returning a book late?
answer: A fine of Rs 2 per day per book is charged for late returns. Fines must be cleared before borrowing new books.

question: Can I access e-journals and online databases from home?
answer: Yes use your university credentials to access JSTOR IEEE Xplore and other databases through the library portal from anywhere.

question: How do I reserve a book that is currently issued?
answer: Log in to the library portal search for the book and click Reserve. You will be notified when it is available.

question: Does the library have a reading room?
answer: Yes the library has a 200-seat reading room open 24 hours during exam periods. Student ID is required for entry.

question: Can I bring food and drinks inside the library?
answer: No food and drinks are strictly not allowed inside the library. Sealed water bottles are the only exception.

question: How do I access digital newspapers in the library?
answer: Digital newspapers and magazines are available on the library portal under the e-Resources section free of charge.

question: Who do I contact for library-related issues?
answer: Contact the library help desk at library@university.edu or call extension 2045 during working hours.

question: What types of hostel accommodation are available?
answer: The university offers single occupancy double occupancy and triple sharing rooms in separate hostels for boys and girls.

question: How do I apply for hostel accommodation?
answer: Apply through the student portal during the admission process or before June 30 for continuing students. Allotment is on a first-come basis.

question: What facilities are available in the hostel?
answer: Hostels are equipped with Wi-Fi laundry mess CCTV hot water gym and 24-hour security.

question: Can I change my room in the hostel?
answer: Room change requests can be submitted to the hostel warden after the first month. Changes are granted based on availability.

question: What is the hostel curfew time?
answer: All students must return to the hostel by 10 PM on weekdays and 11 PM on weekends. Prior permission is required for late entry.

question: Is outside food allowed in the hostel?
answer: Outside food can be ordered to the hostel gate. No delivery persons are allowed inside the hostel premises.

question: What is the process for hostel checkout?
answer: Submit a checkout request to the warden 48 hours in advance clear mess dues return room keys and get a clearance certificate.

question: Are guests allowed to visit in the hostel?
answer: Guests are allowed only in the common visitor room between 10 AM and 6 PM on weekends with prior permission from the warden.

question: What should I do in case of a maintenance issue in my hostel room?
answer: Report maintenance issues to the hostel warden or fill a complaint form at the hostel office. Issues are addressed within 48 hours.

question: Is the hostel mess vegetarian or non-vegetarian?
answer: The university mess serves both vegetarian and non-vegetarian meals. Separate counters are available for both.

question: What bus routes does the university operate?
answer: The university operates buses on 12 routes covering major residential areas in the city. Route details are on the transport portal.

question: How do I get a university bus pass?
answer: Submit the bus pass application form with two photos and the semester fee at the transport office. Passes are issued within 3 days.

question: What is the cost of the university bus pass per semester?
answer: Bus pass fees range from Rs 3000 to Rs 6000 per semester depending on the distance of the pickup point.

question: What time do university buses start running?
answer: University buses begin service at 7:00 AM from designated stops and the last return service departs from campus at 6:30 PM.

question: Can I board any university bus or only my designated one?
answer: You must board the bus assigned to your registered route. Boarding other routes is allowed only with written permission from transport office.

question: What do I do if my bus doesn't show up?
answer: Call the transport helpline at extension 3010 or use the university transport app to report the absence and arrange alternate transport.

question: Is there a university transport app?
answer: Yes the university transport app allows you to track buses in real time and get notifications about delays. Download from the student portal.

question: Can final year students use university transport?
answer: Yes final year students can continue using university transport till their last working day by renewing their pass.

question: Are there any bus services on Sundays?
answer: University bus services are not available on Sundays and public holidays unless special services are announced.

question: What happens if I lose my bus pass?
answer: Report the loss to the transport office immediately. A duplicate pass can be issued after paying Rs 100 replacement fee.

question: What is the exam schedule for the current semester?
answer: The exam schedule is published on the university website and student portal at least 3 weeks before exams begin.

question: How do I download my hall ticket for exams?
answer: Log in to the student portal go to Examinations and download your hall ticket. It will be available 10 days before exams.

question: Can I write exams without a hall ticket?
answer: No hall ticket is mandatory to enter the exam hall. Duplicate hall tickets can be obtained from the exam section.

question: What items am I allowed to carry into the exam hall?
answer: You may carry your hall ticket ID card pens pencils geometry box and a water bottle. No electronic devices are allowed.

question: What happens if I am caught cheating in an exam?
answer: Use of unfair means leads to cancellation of that exam and may result in suspension or expulsion depending on severity.

question: Can I request a re-exam if I miss an exam due to illness?
answer: Submit a medical certificate within 3 days of the missed exam. Re-exam approval is subject to committee review.

question: What is the duration of end semester exams?
answer: End semester exams are typically 3 hours long for theory papers and 2 hours for practical exams.

question: How are practical exams conducted?
answer: Practical exams are conducted in the respective labs with internal and external examiners evaluating your performance and record.

question: Is there a seating arrangement for exams?
answer: Yes seating is assigned randomly and published on the notice board outside the exam hall 30 minutes before the exam.

question: Can I use a calculator in exams?
answer: Use of calculators is allowed only in specific subjects as mentioned in the exam instructions. Otherwise no calculator is permitted.

question: What are the semester start and end dates?
answer: The odd semester typically starts in July and ends in November. The even semester starts in January and ends in May.

question: When is the academic calendar published?
answer: The academic calendar for the upcoming year is published on the university website by the last week of April.

question: How many working days are there per semester?
answer: Each semester has approximately 90 working days including labs and tutorials as per UGC guidelines.

question: What is the date of the mid-semester break?
answer: The mid-semester break is usually a week-long falling in the 8th or 9th week of the semester as per the academic calendar.

question: When does the registration for next semester courses open?
answer: Course registration for the next semester opens 4 weeks before the current semester ends.

question: Are there any study holidays before exams?
answer: Study holidays of 3 to 5 days are given before the start of end-semester exams to allow revision time.

question: When is the university foundation day holiday?
answer: Foundation day is celebrated on March 15 and is a university holiday with cultural events organized for all students.

question: How many weeks before exams is the timetable published?
answer: The exam timetable is published at least 21 days before the first exam date on the university website.

question: What is the schedule for supplementary exams?
answer: Supplementary exams are typically held 4 to 6 weeks after the main exam results are declared.

question: When does convocation take place?
answer: Convocation is held annually in February for all students who completed their programs in the preceding academic year.

question: Which holidays are observed by the university?
answer: The university observes all national holidays state public holidays and a few university-specific holidays totaling about 30 days annually.

question: Is there a holiday on the day of local body elections?
answer: Yes the university declares a holiday on election days within the city as per the Election Commission directive.

question: Do we get holidays during the Diwali and Eid festivals?
answer: Yes major festivals like Diwali Eid Christmas and Pongal are included in the holiday list. Exact dates are in the academic calendar.

question: Can the university cancel a declared holiday?
answer: In rare circumstances declared holidays may be rescheduled if there is a national emergency or academic urgency with prior notice.

question: Are compensatory holidays given for classes held on public holidays?
answer: Yes if classes are conducted on a public holiday a compensatory holiday is given within the same month.

question: What is the placement cell and what does it do?
answer: The placement cell coordinates campus recruitment activities connects students with companies and provides career counseling and interview preparation.

question: When does the placement season begin?
answer: Campus placement season starts in August for final year students with pre-placement talks and aptitude test drives.

question: What is the average placement rate of the university?
answer: The university has consistently achieved a placement rate of over 85% for eligible final year students in the past 3 years.

question: What is the highest package offered during campus placements?
answer: The highest package offered in the most recent placement season was Rs 24 LPA from a multinational technology company.

question: How do I register for campus placements?
answer: Final year students must register through the placement portal by submitting their updated resume and CGPA certificate before the deadline.

question: Is there a minimum CGPA requirement to sit for placement drives?
answer: Most companies require a minimum CGPA of 6.0 and no active backlogs to participate in campus recruitment.

question: Can I participate in multiple company drives?
answer: Yes you can appear in multiple drives but once you receive and accept an offer you are typically not allowed to sit in further drives.

question: What types of companies visit for campus recruitment?
answer: The placement cell hosts IT companies manufacturing firms banks consulting firms and startups for recruitment.

question: What is the procedure if a company shortlists me?
answer: The placement cell will notify you via email with details about the next round. You must confirm participation within 24 hours.

question: How do I submit my resume to the placement cell?
answer: Upload your resume in PDF format to the placement portal under the My Profile section and ensure all details are up to date.

question: How do I apply for an internship through the university?
answer: Register on the internship portal fill the application form choose preferred sector and submit. The placement cell will match you with available opportunities.

question: Is it mandatory to do an internship?
answer: Internships are mandatory for final year B.Tech and MBA students as part of the curriculum and carry academic credits.

question: How long is the mandatory internship period?
answer: The mandatory internship is typically 8 weeks for B.Tech students and 10 weeks for MBA students during summer vacation.

question: Can I find my own internship outside the placement portal?
answer: Yes self-sourced internships are allowed subject to approval from the HOD and the placement cell. Submit the offer letter for verification.

question: Is the internship stipend compulsory?
answer: The university recommends companies provide a minimum stipend of Rs 8000 per month but it is not mandatory for all internships.

question: How do I get an internship completion certificate?
answer: Submit the employer's completion certificate and your internship report to the placement cell. An acknowledgment letter is issued.

question: Can I convert an internship into a full-time job offer?
answer: Yes Pre-Placement Offers from internship employers are recognized and facilitate direct job placement for eligible students.

question: What sectors are available for MBA internships?
answer: MBA internships span finance marketing operations HR IT and consulting. The placement cell ties up with firms in all these sectors.

question: Are international internships available?
answer: The university has MoUs with select international firms. Top students may be nominated for international internship programs.

question: Is there an orientation for internship preparation?
answer: Yes the placement cell conducts a 2-day internship orientation covering resume writing communication skills and professional etiquette.

question: What companies have visited the campus for placement in the past year?
answer: Companies like TCS Infosys Wipro HCL Cognizant Deloitte Amazon and HDFC Bank visited campus in the last placement season.

question: How many companies participate in campus recruitment each year?
answer: On average 120 to 150 companies participate in campus recruitment across all departments each academic year.

question: Does the university have tie-ups with any specific companies?
answer: Yes the university has MoUs with over 40 companies for internships research collaborations and preferential recruitment.

question: Can alumni companies participate in campus recruitment?
answer: Yes alumni are encouraged to refer their companies to the placement cell for campus recruitment drives.

question: Are startups also invited for campus recruitment?
answer: Yes the placement cell actively invites funded startups and encourages students to consider startup opportunities alongside established companies.

question: What training does the university provide for placement preparation?
answer: The training and placement cell offers aptitude training technical mock tests group discussions mock interviews and soft skills workshops.

question: Is placement training mandatory for final year students?
answer: Attendance in placement training sessions is strongly recommended. Students with less than 60% training attendance may be deprioritized in placements.

question: What topics are covered in aptitude training?
answer: Aptitude training covers quantitative aptitude logical reasoning verbal ability data interpretation and coding challenges.

question: Are there any online courses provided by the university for skill development?
answer: Yes the university provides free access to platforms like Coursera and NPTEL through institutional subscriptions for enrolled students.

question: How do I prepare for a group discussion round?
answer: The placement cell organizes weekly GD practice sessions. Join through the placement portal to sign up for the next slot.

question: Who conducts the technical training for engineering students?
answer: Technical training is conducted by a combination of internal faculty industry experts and third-party training partners.

question: Is there a mock interview facility available?
answer: Yes mock interviews are scheduled every Friday at the placement cell. Register 3 days in advance to secure a slot.

question: Can I get individual career counseling from the placement cell?
answer: Yes one-on-one career counseling sessions are available with the career advisor. Book an appointment through the placement portal.

question: Are there any certification courses offered by the university?
answer: Yes the university offers short-term certification courses in data analytics cloud computing digital marketing and project management.

question: How do I get access to LinkedIn Premium through the university?
answer: Final year students can apply for complimentary LinkedIn Premium access through the placement portal under Career Tools.

question: What is the university's code of conduct for students?
answer: Students are expected to respect peers faculty and staff follow academic integrity guidelines and maintain decorum in all university premises.

question: What are the consequences of violating the code of conduct?
answer: Violations may result in warnings suspension fine community service or expulsion depending on the nature and severity of the act.

question: Is smoking or alcohol allowed on campus?
answer: Smoking and consumption of alcohol are strictly prohibited anywhere on university premises and will lead to disciplinary action.

question: What is the policy on using mobile phones in class?
answer: Mobile phones must be on silent mode during class time. Use of phones during lectures is prohibited unless permitted by faculty.

question: Can students hold protests or demonstrations on campus?
answer: Students may organize peaceful demonstrations only with prior permission from the student affairs office at least 48 hours in advance.

question: What is the anti-ragging policy?
answer: Ragging in any form is a criminal offense under UGC regulations. Perpetrators face suspension police complaint and possible expulsion.

question: Are students allowed to invite outsiders to the campus?
answer: Outsiders may visit campus only with a formal invitation from a registered student or faculty and must register at the security gate.

question: What happens if a student is found with drugs?
answer: Possession or consumption of drugs on campus is treated as a zero-tolerance offence and results in immediate expulsion and police complaint.

question: Is the dress code mandatory on campus?
answer: Yes students are expected to dress in modest formal or semi-formal attire. Specific departments may have lab dress codes.

question: Can student organizations operate on campus?
answer: Yes registered student clubs and organizations can operate with faculty advisor approval. New clubs must submit a proposal to the student affairs office.

question: How do I apply for medical leave?
answer: Submit the medical leave application along with a doctor's certificate to the class advisor or HOD within 3 days of resuming class.

question: How many days of casual leave can I take per semester?
answer: Students are allowed up to 5 days of casual leave per semester with prior approval from the class advisor.

question: Can I apply for leave for personal or family reasons?
answer: Personal leave can be granted up to 3 days per semester on valid grounds with HOD approval.

question: What is the process for applying for long-term leave?
answer: For leave exceeding 5 days submit a formal application to the dean of students with supporting documents and family contact information.

question: Do leave days count against my attendance?
answer: Yes all leave days including medical and casual leave are counted as absent for attendance calculation purposes.

question: Can I get retroactive leave approval after rejoining?
answer: Retroactive leave approval may be granted for genuine emergencies if documents are submitted within 3 days of rejoining.

question: What happens if I go on leave without permission?
answer: Unauthorized absence may result in disciplinary action and all absent days without approval are considered unmarked absences.

question: Is there a leave application form available online?
answer: Yes the leave application form is available on the student portal under the Academic Forms section.

question: Can I apply for leave during exam preparation days?
answer: Leave during the pre-exam study holidays is not required. However leave during regular class days before exams requires HOD approval.

question: Are there paid internship leaves for mandatory internships?
answer: Students on mandatory internship are marked as on duty and their internship period does not count as absence.

question: What documents are required for fresh admission to the B.Sc program?
answer: You need 10th and 12th mark sheets school transfer certificate Aadhaar card caste certificate income certificate and passport photos.

question: Is an interview required for postgraduate admissions?
answer: Yes shortlisted candidates for PG programs must attend a personal interview and academic assessment before final admission.

question: What is the cut-off percentage for arts programs admission?
answer: Admission to arts programs requires a minimum of 50% in Class 12 with the relevant stream. Merit list is prepared based on marks.

question: Are NRI admissions open?
answer: Yes the university has a separate NRI quota. Candidates must apply through the international admissions portal with apostilled documents.

question: What is a merit list and when is it published?
answer: The merit list ranks candidates based on qualifying exam marks and is published on the admissions portal within 7 days of application close.

question: Can I join the program mid-semester?
answer: Mid-semester enrollment is not permitted. All new students must join at the start of the academic semester.

question: Is counseling available before choosing a program?
answer: Yes the admissions office offers free pre-admission counseling sessions every Saturday from 10 AM to 1 PM.

question: Do I need to submit original documents at the time of admission?
answer: Original documents must be produced for verification at the time of admission. Originals are returned after verification is done.

question: How many seats are reserved for differently-abled students?
answer: 3% of total seats in each program are reserved for differently-abled candidates as per government policy.

question: Can I change my program after admission?
answer: Program changes within the university can be requested in the first two weeks of the semester subject to eligibility and seat availability.

question: What is the procedure for getting a scholarship after joining?
answer: Submit the scholarship application form along with income proof mark sheets and caste certificate to the scholarship section within 30 days of joining.

question: Is the National Scholarship Portal linked with the university?
answer: Yes the university is registered on the National Scholarship Portal and students can apply for NSP scholarships using their enrollment number.

question: Is there a scholarship for first-generation learners?
answer: Yes the First Generation Learner Scholarship provides Rs 12000 per year for meritorious students from economically weaker sections.

question: How is scholarship amount disbursed?
answer: Approved scholarship amounts are directly transferred to the student's registered bank account within 6 to 8 weeks of approval.

question: Can a student reapply for scholarship if rejected in the previous year?
answer: Yes students can reapply every year if they meet the eligibility criteria. Each application is evaluated independently.

question: What is the university's top scholarship and who is eligible?
answer: The Chancellor's Merit Award of Rs 1 lakh per year is given to the top-ranking student of each program who maintains above 9.0 CGPA.

question: Do sports scholarships cover hostel fees?
answer: Sports scholarships cover tuition fee waiver only. Hostel and mess fees must be paid separately by the student.

question: Is there a scholarship specifically for girl students?
answer: Yes the university offers a Women Empowerment Scholarship of Rs 10000 per year for meritorious girl students from economically weaker sections.

question: Are there any scholarships for students with disabilities?
answer: Yes the university provides a full tuition fee waiver and a monthly stipend of Rs 2000 for students with more than 40% disability.

question: What is the process to renew a scholarship each year?
answer: Submit renewal application with latest mark sheets attendance record and updated income certificate before the annual deadline.

question: What should I do if I want to report a faculty misconduct?
answer: Submit a written complaint to the HOD. If unresolved contact the dean of academics or the internal grievance committee.

question: How do I appeal against an exam result?
answer: Submit a result appeal form with payment of Rs 500 to the exam section within 15 days of result announcement. Appeals are reviewed in 30 days.

question: Can I dispute internal assessment marks?
answer: Internal mark disputes must be raised with the faculty within 7 days of marks being published. HOD mediates if unresolved.

question: What is the policy for academic dishonesty?
answer: Academic dishonesty including plagiarism and cheating results in zero marks for the assignment suspension or expulsion.

question: How is plagiarism checked in assignments?
answer: Assignments are scanned using Turnitin software. Content similarity above 20% is flagged and may result in disciplinary action.

question: Can I retake an exam if I fail in a subject?
answer: Yes students can appear in the supplementary exam held after results. A fee of Rs 300 per subject applies.

question: Is there a mechanism to escalate complaints to university management?
answer: Yes unresolved complaints can be escalated to the registrar's office in writing. A response is guaranteed within 21 days.

question: What is the university's policy on gender harassment?
answer: The university has a zero-tolerance policy on gender harassment enforced by the Internal Complaints Committee as per the POSH Act.

question: Can I raise a complaint about infrastructure issues?
answer: Yes infrastructure complaints can be submitted through the student portal or directly to the facility management department.

question: What are the legal rights of students in the university?
answer: Students have the right to fair assessment grievance redressal transparent administration and a safe learning environment as per UGC norms.

question: What is the procedure for lateral entry admission to second year B.Tech?
answer: Diploma holders can apply for direct second-year admission through the LEET examination. Apply before May 31 with diploma mark sheets and character certificate.

question: Is there an age limit for postgraduate admissions?
answer: There is no upper age limit for PG admissions. However candidates must satisfy the academic eligibility criteria.

question: Do I need a language proficiency score for admission?
answer: Indian students do not need an English proficiency score. International students must submit IELTS 6.0 or TOEFL 80 equivalents.

question: Can working professionals apply to the MBA program?
answer: Yes the university offers an Executive MBA for working professionals with a minimum of 2 years of work experience.

question: What is the dress code for document verification day?
answer: Students attending document verification are expected to dress formally. ID proof must be carried along with all original documents.

question: How many rounds of counseling are conducted for admission?
answer: The university conducts up to 3 rounds of counseling to fill remaining seats. Round details are published on the admissions portal.

question: Is there an entrance exam for BBA admission?
answer: BBA admission is merit-based on Class 12 marks. No separate entrance exam is conducted by the university.

question: Can I apply for direct PhD admission after a master's degree?
answer: Yes candidates with a master's degree and valid UGC-NET or university entrance test score can apply directly for PhD programs.

question: What is the ratio of university seats to management quota seats?
answer: 85% of seats are under government quota and 15% are under management quota across all programs.

question: Is there a provision for campus visits before admission?
answer: Yes the university organizes Open House events every April where prospective students and parents can visit campus and interact with faculty.

question: What is the minimum hardware configuration required for a laptop for engineering students?
answer: Engineering students are recommended to use a laptop with at least Intel Core i5 8GB RAM 512GB SSD and Windows 10 or above.

question: Are computer labs open after hours?
answer: Computer labs in the library block are open till 9 PM on weekdays. Access requires student ID card and prior lab booking.

question: Is Wi-Fi available across campus?
answer: Yes high-speed Wi-Fi is available throughout the campus including hostels classrooms and the library with up to 100 Mbps speed.

question: How do I get campus Wi-Fi credentials?
answer: Wi-Fi login credentials are shared with your university email within 48 hours of enrollment. Contact IT support for issues.

question: Is there a campus store where I can buy stationery?
answer: Yes the campus bookstore in Block A sells stationery textbooks university merchandise and photocopying services from 9 AM to 6 PM.

question: What sports facilities are available on campus?
answer: The campus has a football ground basketball court cricket nets badminton courts swimming pool and a fully equipped gymnasium.

question: Can students use the gym free of charge?
answer: Yes the gym is free for enrolled students. You must register for gym access through the sports department.

question: Is there a medical facility on campus?
answer: Yes the university health center is staffed with a doctor and nurse and is open from 9 AM to 5 PM Monday to Saturday.

question: What should I do in case of a medical emergency on campus?
answer: Call the campus emergency number at extension 1011 or proceed to the health center. Ambulance support is available on call.

question: Is there a cafeteria and what are its timings?
answer: The campus cafeteria is open from 7:30 AM to 8:30 PM on weekdays and 8 AM to 6 PM on weekends serving meals snacks and beverages.

question: How are mid-semester exam marks calculated?
answer: Mid-semester exams contribute 20 marks each. The better of the two mid-semester scores is typically taken for internal assessment.

question: What is the passing mark for individual subjects?
answer: Students must score a minimum of 40% in external exams and an overall 50% including internal marks to pass a subject.

question: Can I carry a backlog from third semester to fifth semester?
answer: Yes you can carry backlogs forward but you must clear all backlogs before your final semester to be eligible for graduation.

question: How are project submissions evaluated?
answer: Projects are evaluated by an internal guide and external examiner. Assessment includes report quality presentation and viva-voce performance.

question: What is a detained student and what are the implications?
answer: A detained student is one barred from exams due to low attendance or fee default. They must reapply for the next semester.

question: Can I choose my own project topic for the final year project?
answer: Yes you can propose your own project topic which must be approved by your project guide and department review committee.

question: Is there a format for writing lab records?
answer: Yes each department provides a standard format for lab records. Records must be submitted and signed by the faculty after each practical.

question: What is the maximum number of attempts allowed to clear a backlog?
answer: Students may attempt a backlog subject up to 5 times during their enrolled program duration.

question: Are online tools allowed for academic submissions?
answer: Yes online tools and software are encouraged for assignments and projects but all submissions must be original and properly cited.

question: How do I request additional time in exams for a medical condition?
answer: Submit a request to the exam controller with a valid medical certificate at least 7 days before the exam. Extra time up to 30 minutes may be granted.

question: How do I apply for a program transfer within the university?
answer: Submit a transfer request to the dean of academics within the first 2 weeks of the semester with CGPA records and reasons for transfer.

question: What is the process to switch from regular to distance mode of study?
answer: Submit a mode switch request with valid reasons to the academic office. Approval depends on program availability in distance mode.

question: Can a foreign national apply for admission to regular programs?
answer: Yes foreign nationals can apply through the international admissions portal. They must hold equivalent qualifications to Indian Class 12.

question: How do I opt out of hostel midway through the semester?
answer: Submit a hostel exit application to the warden with parent permission. Refund is calculated based on the date of checkout.

question: Is there a student representative council?
answer: Yes the Student Representative Council is elected every year and serves as a bridge between students and university administration.

question: How do I become part of the student council?
answer: SRC elections are held in August. Eligible students who have completed one year and have CGPA above 6.0 can contest elections.

question: What cultural events does the university organize?
answer: The university organizes an annual cultural fest technical fest sports meet and departmental symposiums throughout the year.

question: How do I register for the annual cultural fest?
answer: Registration for the cultural fest opens online 4 weeks before the event. Teams and individuals can register through the fest portal.

question: Are there clubs for coding debate music and arts?
answer: Yes the university has active clubs for coding debate music drama photography robotics and many other interests.

question: How do I join a university club?
answer: Club registrations open in the first week of each semester. Visit the student activities portal and apply for clubs of your choice.

question: Can I start a new club at the university?
answer: Yes submit a club formation proposal to the student affairs office with a faculty advisor's consent and a minimum of 15 student members.

question: Are there inter-university sports events?
answer: Yes the university participates in inter-university sports meets organized under AIU. Outstanding performers represent the university at national level.

question: What is the process to represent the university in a national competition?
answer: Get a recommendation letter from your HOD or sports coordinator submit it to the dean of student affairs and obtain official permission.

question: Is there a reward for students who bring laurels to the university?
answer: Yes students who win national or international competitions are rewarded with cash prizes certificates and recognition at the annual prize day.

question: What is the policy on mobile usage in the library?
answer: Mobile phones must be kept on silent mode in the library. Calls are not allowed inside. A designated phone zone is available outside.

question: Are water purifiers available in hostels and classrooms?
answer: Yes RO water purifiers are installed in all hostel blocks academic blocks and the cafeteria for safe drinking water.

question: Is there a dedicated parking zone for students?
answer: Yes a separate student two-wheeler parking zone is available near the main gate. Four-wheelers are not permitted for students.

question: How do I register my vehicle on campus?
answer: Submit the vehicle registration form with vehicle RC copy and ID card at the security office. A vehicle sticker will be issued.

question: What is the process for obtaining an NOC for higher studies?
answer: Submit the NOC request form to the registrar with proof of admission from the foreign or domestic institution. NOC is issued within 5 working days.

question: How do I verify my degree certificate online?
answer: All degree certificates have a unique QR code. Scan it or visit the verification portal at the university website to confirm authenticity.

question: Can I get course syllabus copies for visa or further study applications?
answer: Yes the official course syllabus document is available from the academic section with a university seal upon request.

question: Is the university accredited?
answer: Yes the university is accredited by NAAC with an A+ grade and is approved by the UGC AICTE and respective regulatory bodies.

question: Where can I find the university's annual report?
answer: The annual report is published on the university's official website under the About section and is available in digital format.

question: How do I get the official university email address?
answer: Your university email is created automatically during enrollment and credentials are shared through SMS to your registered mobile number.

question: Can I forward my university emails to a personal email?
answer: Yes you can set up email forwarding in the university mail settings. However confidential communications should only be read on official mail.

question: What is the process to get a no-dues certificate?
answer: Apply for no-dues through the student portal. Clearance is required from library hostel finance and department before issuance.

question: How do I get my enrollment number if I forgot it?
answer: Log in to the student portal with your registered mobile OTP or contact the student records section with your name and date of birth.

question: Is there a lost and found counter on campus?
answer: Yes the lost and found counter is located near the security cabin at the main gate. Found items are kept for 30 days.

question: How do I submit feedback about a course or faculty?
answer: Anonymous course and faculty feedback is collected at the end of each semester through the student portal feedback module.

question: Is there a system to track my academic progress?
answer: Yes the student portal has an academic progress dashboard showing your grades attendance credits earned and pending requirements.

question: Can I access old question papers for exam preparation?
answer: Previous years' question papers are available in the library digital archive and on the university learning management system.

question: How do I report a bug or issue with the student portal?
answer: Report technical issues via email to itsupport@university.edu or log a ticket on the IT help desk portal with a screenshot of the issue.

question: What is the process to get a letter of recommendation from a professor?
answer: Approach the professor at least 2 weeks before your deadline explain the purpose and provide a draft if needed. Most faculty respond within 7 days.

question: Are there mentorship programs available for freshers?
answer: Yes the university assigns each first-year student a senior student mentor for the first semester to help with academic and campus life transition.

question: How do I participate in university-level research projects?
answer: Contact your department's research coordinator or check the research portal for ongoing projects accepting student researchers.

question: Can undergraduates publish research papers?
answer: Yes undergraduates can co-author papers with faculty guidance. The university supports student publications in journals and conference proceedings.

question: Is there a language lab for communication skill development?
answer: Yes the university has a dedicated language lab with software for spoken English IELTS preparation and presentation skills training.

question: What support is available for students with learning disabilities?
answer: The university provides extra time in exams scribes if needed and special counseling. Register with the disability support cell at the start of the program.

question: How do I access the university health insurance scheme?
answer: All enrolled students are automatically covered under the university group health insurance scheme. Policy details are available at the student services desk.

question: What is the process to change my registered mobile number?
answer: Submit a mobile number change request form with valid ID proof to the student records section. Update takes 3 working days.

question: Can I request a name correction on my documents?
answer: Submit a name correction request with your legal name proof such as Aadhaar or passport to the registrar. Documents are updated within 10 working days.

question: Is there a facility for international students to convert foreign documents?
answer: Yes the international students' office assists with apostille verification and document translation services for admitted foreign students.

question: How do I get permission to conduct an event on campus?
answer: Submit an event proposal form at least 10 days in advance to the student affairs office. Approval is granted within 5 days.

question: What rules apply to using the university auditorium?
answer: The auditorium can be booked for academic or cultural events only with prior approval. Food and decoration must follow event management guidelines.

question: Are there any startup incubation facilities on campus?
answer: Yes the university has an Entrepreneurship Development Cell and an incubation center that supports student startups with mentoring and seed funding.

question: How do I pitch my startup idea to the incubation center?
answer: Submit your business plan to the EDC office or email it to edc@university.edu. Shortlisted ideas are invited for presentation before the panel.

question: Is there financial support available for student startups?
answer: Selected startups may receive seed funding up to Rs 2 lakhs from the university incubation fund along with free co-working space for one year.

question: What is the procedure for getting a study room booked in the library?
answer: Study rooms in the library can be booked online up to 2 days in advance for 2-hour slots. Maximum 6 students per room.

question: How do I access the virtual classroom during an online session?
answer: Click the class link shared by the faculty on the LMS or university email at the scheduled time. Ensure camera and mic are functional.

question: What should I do if I face issues accessing the LMS?
answer: Contact itsupport@university.edu or call extension 2080 during office hours. Include your enrollment number and a description of the issue.

question: Are there any facilities for night study in the library?
answer: The library extends its hours to midnight during exam weeks. Student ID must be shown at the entrance for night study access.

question: Is there a prayer room or meditation space on campus?
answer: Yes the university has a multi-faith prayer room in Block D available to all students from 6 AM to 9 PM every day.

question: What are the rules for using the swimming pool?
answer: The swimming pool is open from 6 AM to 8 AM and 5 PM to 7 PM. Proper swimwear is mandatory and a valid sports registration is required.

question: Can students request special dietary meals in the hostel mess?
answer: Medically required special diets can be arranged by submitting a doctor's prescription to the hostel warden. Standard alternate options are available daily.

question: What is the timetable notification process for students?
answer: Timetables are published on the student portal and department notice boards at least 3 days before a new semester begins.

question: How do I know if my fee payment was successful?
answer: You will receive an SMS and email confirmation within minutes of payment. Log in to the portal to view payment status under My Fees.

question: Can I get my academic records verified without visiting the campus?
answer: Yes online academic verification for employers or institutions can be requested through the university verification portal with a fee of Rs 250.

question: What is the policy for exam day tardiness?
answer: Students arriving more than 30 minutes after the exam starts are not allowed to enter. No extra time is granted for late arrivals.

question: How is the university's internal quality assurance handled?
answer: The Internal Quality Assurance Cell conducts periodic audits collects student feedback and prepares annual quality reports for accreditation purposes.

question: Can I appeal my attendance record if I think it was marked incorrectly?
answer: Yes submit a written attendance correction request with supporting proof such as gate entry records to the class advisor within 7 days.

question: What is the process for obtaining a character certificate?
answer: Apply at the student services office with your ID card and pay Rs 50. The character certificate is issued within 3 working days.

question: Is there a grievance box for anonymous complaints?
answer: Yes grievance boxes are located outside all academic blocks and the hostel reception. Boxes are opened and reviewed every Monday.

question: How do I know which subjects I need to register for next semester?
answer: Check the program curriculum on the student portal. Mandatory subjects are pre-loaded and electives can be selected during registration window.

question: What happens if I don't complete my project submission on time?
answer: Late project submissions attract a penalty of 10% marks deduction per day. After 5 days the submission is marked zero.

question: Can I submit my project report in digital format?
answer: Yes digital submission is accepted through the LMS in PDF format. Hard copy submission may also be required depending on the department.

question: How many electives are available in the third year of B.Tech?
answer: Third year B.Tech students can choose from over 30 electives across 6 specialization tracks. Seat allocation is on a first-come basis.

question: What is the minimum grade required to be eligible for the dean's list?
answer: Students who score above 9.0 CGPA with zero backlogs and full attendance in a semester are included in the dean's list.

question: Can I upgrade my grade by appearing in a later exam?
answer: Yes grade improvement exams allow students to better their grade. Only the higher of the two scores is considered for CGPA.

question: What is the timeline for receiving an offer letter from placement companies?
answer: Companies typically release offer letters within 4 weeks of the final placement round. Delays beyond 8 weeks should be reported to the placement cell.

question: How do I get an experience certificate after an internship?
answer: Your internship company provides the experience certificate. The placement cell can help you draft a request letter if the company delays.

question: Is there a coding bootcamp offered by the training division?
answer: Yes the placement training division offers a 4-week coding bootcamp before placement season covering DSA Java and Python.

question: What programming languages are taught in the training program?
answer: Training includes Python Java C++ SQL and JavaScript. Industry tools like Git and Linux commands are also covered.

question: How do I access NPTEL lectures for my enrolled courses?
answer: Log in to NPTEL portal and enroll in the course using your university email for free access to video lectures and assignments.

question: Can NPTEL certification be counted towards academic credits?
answer: Yes NPTEL certifications approved by the department can be counted as elective credits. Apply to your HOD with the certificate.

question: What is the process to register for a university-sponsored hackathon?
answer: Visit the innovation portal register your team of 3 to 4 members and submit your problem statement by the given deadline.

question: Are there any IEEE or ACM student chapters at the university?
answer: Yes the university has active IEEE and ACM student chapters. Join through the respective chapter portals or attend chapter orientation sessions.

question: How do I apply for permission to present a paper at an external conference?
answer: Submit the paper acceptance letter to your HOD and apply for duty leave and travel grant from the research office.

question: Is travel grant available for student paper presentations?
answer: Yes a travel grant of up to Rs 10000 is available for students presenting papers at national conferences and Rs 25

question: Can I take a gap year within the program?
answer: Gap year requests are considered only in extraordinary circumstances and require dean approval. Enrollment is not automatically preserved.

question: What is the process to rejoin the program after a gap year?
answer: Submit a rejoining request with gap year justification and supporting documents to the dean of academics 30 days before semester start.

question: How do I check if my name is on the provisional exam list?
answer: Check the provisional exam list published on the student portal 10 days before exams. Raise concerns within 5 days if your name is missing.

question: What are duty leave days and how are they different from casual leave?
answer: Duty leave is granted for university-sanctioned activities like competitions and events and does not count as absence for attendance purposes.

question: How do I get duty leave for attending a national competition?
answer: Submit the invitation letter or registration proof to your HOD at least 5 days before the event. Approval is granted within 2 days.

question: Can I change my elective after the registration deadline?
answer: Elective changes after the deadline are allowed only with HOD approval and only within the first two weeks of the semester.

question: Is there a provision for credit transfer for courses done at other universities?
answer: Credit transfer is possible for MOOCs and exchange programs. Submit the course completion certificate and syllabus for department evaluation.

question: How do I apply for an exchange program with a partner university?
answer: Apply through the international relations office with your CGPA record and a statement of purpose. Shortlisted candidates are interviewed.

question: What CGPA is required for exchange program eligibility?
answer: Most exchange programs require a minimum CGPA of 7.5 with no active backlogs at the time of application.

question: What is the process to get permission to work part-time while studying?
answer: Full-time students must seek HOD permission before taking up part-time work. Work must not conflict with class hours or exams.

question: Is there a printing facility for students on campus?
answer: Yes printing facilities are available at the library and department resource rooms. Black and white prints cost Rs 2 per page.

question: How do I submit a request for lab materials or components for my project?
answer: Submit a materials requisition form to the lab technician with your project guide's approval at least 5 working days in advance.

question: Can I stay in the hostel during semester breaks?
answer: Students can stay in the hostel during semester breaks by submitting a prior request and paying the applicable break period charges.

question: Is there a night canteen available in the hostel?
answer: Yes a night canteen in the hostel serves snacks and beverages from 9 PM to 11 PM for hostel residents.

question: What should I do if I have a conflict with a roommate in the hostel?
answer: Report the issue to the hostel warden. Mediation is offered and room reassignment may be done if the conflict is unresolvable.

question: Is laundry service available in the hostel?
answer: Yes coin-operated washing machines are available in each hostel block. Laundry is a self-service facility available 24 hours.

question: Can I cook food in my hostel room?
answer: Cooking in hostel rooms is strictly prohibited due to fire safety regulations. Kitchenette facilities are available in common areas.

question: How do I get a visitor pass for a parent visiting the campus?
answer: Visitor passes for parents are issued at the security gate. The visitor must carry a valid photo ID and state the purpose of the visit.

question: What security measures are in place on campus?
answer: The campus has CCTV surveillance 24-hour security guards biometric access at select facilities and a campus patrol team.

question: Is there a bicycle renting facility on campus?
answer: Yes the campus has a cycle sharing scheme. Register at the sports department and check out a bicycle for free for up to 4 hours.

question: What is the emergency contact number for security on campus?
answer: Campus emergency security can be reached at extension 1000 or on the direct number published on the student portal homepage.

question: How do I report a theft on campus?
answer: Report theft immediately to the security office and file a police complaint. A campus inquiry is also initiated within 24 hours.

question: Are there any lockers available for students?
answer: Student lockers are available in the library and department blocks. Apply for a locker at the student services desk for a semester fee of Rs 100.

question: What is the policy for recording lectures?
answer: Students may not record lectures without prior written consent from the faculty. Approved recordings are for personal study only and cannot be shared.

question: How are class representatives chosen?
answer: Class representatives are elected by students in the first week of semester. Any student with CGPA above 5.5 and no disciplinary record can stand.

question: What are the responsibilities of a class representative?
answer: Class representatives communicate student concerns to faculty schedule meetings represent the class in department meetings and organize class activities.

question: Is there a student newsletter or magazine at the university?
answer: Yes the university publishes a quarterly student magazine and a weekly digital newsletter. Students can contribute articles by emailing the editorial team.

question: How do I join the editorial team for the university newsletter?
answer: Apply through the student activities portal or attend the open recruitment drive held at the start of each academic year.

question: What is the procedure for organizing a guest lecture?
answer: Submit a guest lecture request to the HOD with the proposed speaker's profile and topic at least 2 weeks in advance.

question: Can I invite an industry professional as a guest speaker for a seminar?
answer: Yes student clubs and departments can invite industry professionals. Coordinate with your faculty advisor and the student affairs office for approval.

question: What financial support is available for students organizing events?
answer: Student organizations can apply for event funding from the student welfare fund. Submit a budget proposal to the student affairs office.

question: How do I get permission to display posters on campus?
answer: Submit a poster approval form to the student affairs office. Posters must not contain political or offensive content and must be removed after the event.

question: Are recycling bins available on campus?
answer: Yes the campus has color-coded waste segregation bins for dry wet and e-waste placed across all blocks and common areas.

question: What is the university's policy on environmental sustainability?
answer: The university has a green campus policy that promotes energy conservation rainwater harvesting solar power use and a ban on single-use plastics.

question: Is there a solar power facility on campus?
answer: Yes the university has a 500 KW solar plant on the rooftop of academic blocks providing a significant portion of campus energy needs.

question: How do I contribute to the university's environmental initiatives?
answer: Join the Eco Club to participate in tree plantation drives awareness campaigns and sustainable practices workshops on campus.

question: What is the counseling center and when is it available?
answer: The student counseling center provides psychological support stress management and career counseling. Available weekdays from 10 AM to 4 PM by appointment.

question: How do I book an appointment with the counselor?
answer: Book appointments through the student portal or directly at the counseling center in Block B Room 14. Walk-ins are accepted on Fridays.

question: Is counseling confidential?
answer: Yes all counseling sessions are strictly confidential and information is not shared with faculty parents or administration without your consent.

question: What should I do if I am feeling overwhelmed with academic pressure?
answer: Visit the counseling center speak to a peer support volunteer or contact the student helpline at extension 2222 available 8 AM to 10 PM.

question: Is there a peer support program on campus?
answer: Yes the university has a peer counseling program where trained senior students offer guidance to juniors experiencing academic or personal challenges.

question: What is the anti-discrimination policy of the university?
answer: The university strictly prohibits discrimination based on gender caste religion region disability or economic background. Violations are dealt with severely.

question: Who is the student welfare officer and how do I contact them?
answer: The student welfare officer is the first point of contact for all student issues. Contact at welfare@university.edu or visit Room 205 Admin Block.

question: How does the university handle cases of cyberbullying?
answer: Cyberbullying complaints are handled by the IT department and student affairs jointly. Severe cases are reported to law enforcement.

question: Are there any awareness programs for student mental health?
answer: Yes the university observes Mental Health Awareness Week every October with workshops seminars and open discussions organized by the counseling center.

question: What steps should I take if I witness another student being bullied?
answer: Report the incident immediately to any faculty member or the student affairs office. You can also submit an anonymous complaint online.

question: Is there a mentoring program for students from rural backgrounds?
answer: Yes the Rural Student Integration Program pairs rural students with urban mentors for the first semester to ease the academic and social transition.

question: What support is available for students who are first-time English learners?
answer: The language lab offers remedial English programs and the counseling center supports acclimatization to the English medium academic environment.

question: How do I apply for a mid-semester grade report for scholarship or bank purposes?
answer: Request a mid-semester performance report from the class advisor. The signed report is issued within 3 working days.

question: Can I access the library during holidays?
answer: The library remains closed on national holidays but is open with limited hours on university-declared local holidays. Check the library notice board.

question: What is the procedure for replacing a damaged textbook borrowed from the library?
answer: Report the damage to the library desk. You will be assessed the replacement cost of the book which must be paid before borrowing again.

question: How many journals can I access online through the library subscription?
answer: The library provides access to over 5000 journals through subscriptions to Elsevier Springer Wiley and other academic publishers.

question: Can I suggest a book for the library to acquire?
answer: Yes fill the book suggestion form available at the library counter. Requested books are reviewed and purchased subject to budget availability.

question: What is the interlibrary loan service?
answer: Through interlibrary loan you can borrow books not available in our library from partner institutions. Requests take 7 to 10 working days to fulfill.

question: How do I find out if a particular book is available in the library?
answer: Search the OPAC (Online Public Access Catalog) on the library portal or the library website to check availability and location.

question: Is there a dedicated section for competitive exam preparation in the library?
answer: Yes the library has a competitive exam section with books for UPSC GATE GRE GMAT IELTS and state PSC examinations.

question: What is the process for donating books to the library?
answer: Donated books are evaluated by the librarian. Accepted books are catalogued and added to the collection with a donor acknowledgment tag.

question: Can students access audio-visual learning materials in the library?
answer: Yes the library has a multimedia room with headphones and screens for accessing video lectures documentaries and educational films.

question: How do I generate my library membership card?
answer: Library membership is automatically generated upon enrollment. Visit the library with your student ID to activate your borrowing privileges.
